ʾO-ʾƎgzǝʾǝtǝya Māryām
O My Lady Mary
ʾO-ʾƎgzǝʾǝtǝya Māryām-type stanzas of the miracles of Mary

abstract.p: The ʾO-ʾƎgzǝʾǝtǝya Māryām hymn stanzas, consists 55 poetic textual collections serving as summarizing hymnographic stanzas of the Miracles of Mary. These stanzas were possibly authored by the monk . Among them, 27 stanzas correspond to the , and align with 27 out of the 33 stanzas of version. Notably, six stanzas from the original ʾAkko-nu bǝʾsi version are omitted in this version (no equivalent ʾO-ʾƎgzǝʾǝtǝya Māryām stanzas are made) The earliest known manuscript to preserve the ʾO-ʾƎgzǝʾǝtǝya Māryām stanzas is found in commissioned for King Śarḍa Dǝngǝl, where the author, , inserts his name at the end of each stanza’s final verse, often as a rhymed supplication for St Mary’s intercession. These stanzas were later transmitted in other manuscripts, notably and The latter manuscript uniquely compiles these 27 ʾO-ʾƎgzǝʾǝtǝya Māryām stanzas alongside their parallel counterparts in accurate order, though it omits the miracle narratives.
